masonry.description: A list of all masonry components that make this facade, including soldier courses

type.description: The type of masonry (what style of brick is used)

isVertical.description: Indicates whether the bricks are placed at a 90 degree angle. If unspecified: brick will remain horizontal

bounds.description: The bounds of this masonry surface, i.e. where the masonry stops before the outer edges of the facade. If absent, this masonry covers the entire facade

left.description: The min x value in mm's where this masonry starts. If absent, this masonry extends to the outer left edge of the facade (and further across any facade offsets)

right.description: The min x value in mm's where this masonry ends. If absent, this masonry extends to the outer right edge of the facade (and further across any facade offsets)

bottom.description: The min z (up) value in mm's where this masonry starts. If absent, this masonry extends to the bottom edge of the facade

top.description: The max z (up) value in mm's where this masonry ends. If absent, this masonry extends to the top edge of the facade

yOffset.description: The y value in mm's of this masonry. Use to extrude (-y) or inset (+y) masonry. If absent, y = 0

elements.description: The elements (like windows & doors) that are put into the facade

type.description: The type of this element, i.e. whether its a frame or a windowsill, etc.

id.description: The name/id of this specific element so it can be found

position.description: The position of this element relative to the bottom left of the facade, with its origin being at the bottom left of the element

x.description: The x value in mm's of this element's position

y.description: The y value in mm's of this element's position. Used to extrude (-y) or inset (+y) from/into the facade

z.description: The z (up) value in mm's of this element's position.

width.description: The width of this element (the void that is cut to facilitate this element is based on this value

height.description: The height of this element (the void that is cut to facilitate this element is based on this value
